Investors: Google for Startups Accelerator
Financing Status Note: The company raised $250 million of Series D venture funding in a deal led by Silver Lake and Lightspeed Venture Partners on February 8, 2022, putting the company's pre-money valuation at $10.2 billion. Coatue Management, Beacon Venture Capital and other investors also participated in the round. The funds will be used by the company for hiring and expects its headcount to reach about 200 by year's end. Also, the company raised $64.72 million of Series C venture funding in a deal led by Andreessen Horowitz on November 16, 2021, putting the company's pre-money valuation at $3.49 billion. Coatue Management, Addition, and 5 other investors also participated in the round. The funds will be used to continue focusing on building a platform that brings the benefits of blockchain, decentralization, and Web3 to developers globally. Previously, the company raised $80 million of Series B venture funding in a deal led by Coatue Management and Addition on April 28, 2021, putting the company's pre-money valuation at $425 million. Coinbase Ventures and 21 other investors also participated in the round. The funds will be used by the company to expand its developer platform to support new blockchains, fuel global expansion, and open new offices in the US and internationally.

Financing Status Note: The company raised $230.16 million in its initial public offering on the Nasdaq stock exchange under the ticker symbol of BASE on July 22, 2021. A total of 9,589,999 shares (including the over-allotment option) were sold at a price of $24 per share. After the offering, there was a total of 42,662,800 outstanding shares (including the over-allotment option) at $24 per share, valuing the company at $1.02 billion. The underwriters were granted an option to purchase up to an additional 1,250,869 shares from the company to cover over-allotments, if any. The over-allotment options were exercised in full by the underwriters.

Financing Status Note: The company raised $30.00 million of Series A venture funding in a deal led by Index Ventures and Redpoint Ventures on February 25, 2022, putting the company's pre-money valuation at $145 million. Other undisclosed investors also participated in the round. The funds will be used to build the go-to serverless database that engineers have been waiting for, with powerful features including a fully serverless design that provides automatic scaling, ACID transactions, database branches, zero-downtime migrations, and a full-text search engine with analytics.
